alert.note: Alert for Dauphin; Lebanon (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 5:05PM EST until February 05 at 2:12AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Swatara Creek Near Hershey affecting Lebanon and Dauphin Counties. For the Swatara Creek...including Harper Tavern, Hershey...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Swatara Creek Near Hershey. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, The right, or north bank begins to overflow. Several roadways upstream of the gage are affected by high water. At 8.0 feet, The right, or north bank overflows. Several roads are affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:31 PM EST Friday the stage was 6.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 7.1 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight.
